intro: Althaea tholozanii, commonly known as the Ethiopian marshmallow, is a perennial herb native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Althaea tholozanii is adapted to wet, marshy environments and is often found in swampy areas along rivers.
